title: Font that is similar to Seravek
content: I tried identifont to see if there was a font that was similar to [Seravek](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311184204/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/seravek/index.html), but was unable to find anything. Is there even a font that is remotely similar?
author: Capnhud

comments.content:
I printed the sample .pdf and it just seemed as though in reading the document which are short paragraphs it was difficult reading it.

I am trying to find a sans font that would complement Locator and Seravek was suggested as a possibility.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here
Why a sans only? I would look at a (more contrasting) slab for example, like PMN Caecila or TheSerif.

Seravek is damn close to Martin Majoor's [FF Scala Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311184204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_scala_sans_ot/), although I don't believe either complement Locator. There's just not enough contrast (which is not to say they look alike, they just don't have enough contrast).

Good luck!

<cite>Why a sans only?</cite>

The sans would be used for producing electronic documents.

I am also looking for a complimentary serif font for print as well.
